metadata.name: Voltage
metadata.description:
Did you know that a single lightning bolt is equivalent to 300 Million Volts!!!

This massive single strike with 2 landing points surely topped the scales with its electric charge!

This bolt was one of 100s that rained down across the Desert Southwest South of Phoenix, AZ during a powerful and electric Monsoon Storm. 

The flash was so bright when it occurred that it left me almost blinded by it as this struck a mile or two from my location. 

Sun Lakes, AZ - 07/30/2022
